intro: Lindernia dubia subsp. major, commonly known as the broadleaf lindernia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink to purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Lindernia dubia subsp. major is a perennial herb that is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
